tool.name: TOFCalibration
tool.command:
@QUOTE_FOO@ @EXT_FOO@ #import re
## Preprocessing mkdir in && ln -s '$in' 'in/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in.ext)' && mkdir out && mkdir ext_calibrants && ln -s '$ext_calibrants' 'ext_calibrants/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $ext_calibrants.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($ext_calibrants.ext)' && mkdir ref_masses && ln -s '$ref_masses' 'ref_masses/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $ref_masses.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($ref_masses.ext)' && mkdir tof_const && ln -s '$tof_const' 'tof_const/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $tof_const.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($tof_const.ext)' &&
## Main program call
set -o pipefail && @EXECUTABLE@ -write_ctd ./ && python3 '$__tool_directory__/fill_ctd.py' '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$args_json' '$hardcoded_json' && @EXECUTABLE@ -ini @EXECUTABLE@.ctd -in 'in/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in.ext)' -out 'out/output.${gxy2omsext("mzml")}' -ext_calibrants 'ext_calibrants/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $ext_calibrants.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($ext_calibrants.ext)' -ref_masses 'ref_masses/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $ref_masses.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($ref_masses.ext)' -tof_const 'tof_const/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $tof_const.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($tof_const.ext)'
## Postprocessing && mv 'out/output.${gxy2omsext("mzml")}' '$out' #if "ctd_out_FLAG" in $OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS && mv '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$ctd_out' #end if

param.label: input peak or raw data file
input file containing the external calibrant spectra (peak or raw data)
input file containing reference masses of the external calibrant spectra (one per line)
File containing TOF conversion constants
param.help: These can be either two or three constants. per set, depending on the conversion type. Either one set for all calibrant spectra . (tab separated), or one for each spectrum.. For a detailed description, please have a look at the doxygen documentation.(one set, tab separated, per line) select tabular data sets(s)

param.label: set this flag, if you have peak data, not raw data (the picking parameters are accessible only from the INI file)

param.name: signal_to_noise
param.label: Minimal signal to noise ratio for a peak to be picked

param.name: centroid_percentage
param.label: Percentage of the maximum height that the raw data points must exceed to be taken into account for the calculation of the centroid
param.help: If it is 1 the centroid position corresponds to the position of the highest intensity

param.name: peak_width
param.label: Approximate fwhm of the peaks

param.name: estimate_peak_width
param.label: Flag if the average peak width shall be estimated
param.help: Attention: when this flag is set, the peak_width is ignored

param.name: fwhm_lower_bound_factor
param.label: Factor that calculates the minimal fwhm value from the peak_width
param.help: All peaks with width smaller than fwhm_bound_factor * peak_width are discarded

param.name: fwhm_upper_bound_factor
param.label: Factor that calculates the maximal fwhm value from the peak_width
param.help: All peaks with width greater than fwhm_upper_bound_factor * peak_width are discarded

param.name: iterations
param.label: maximal number of iterations for the fitting step

param.name: position
param.label: penalty term for the fitting of the position:If it differs too much from the initial one it can be penalized

param.name: left_width
param.label: penalty term for the fitting of the left width:If the left width differs too much from the initial one during the fitting it can be penalized

param.name: right_width
param.label: penalty term for the fitting of the right width:If the right width differs too much from the initial one during the fitting it can be penalized

param.name: height
param.label: penalty term for the fitting of the intensity (only used in 2D Optimization):If it gets negative during the fitting it can be penalized

param.name: tolerance_mz
param.label: mz tolerance for cluster construction

param.name: max_peak_distance
param.label: maximal peak distance in mz in a cluste

param.name: peak_bound
param.label: Minimal peak intensity

param.name: peak_bound_ms2_level
param.label: Minimal peak intensity for MS/MS peaks

param.name: correlation
param.label: minimal correlation of a peak and the raw signal
param.help: If a peak has a lower correlation it is skipped

param.name: noise_level
param.label: noise level for the search of the peak endpoints

param.name: search_radius
param.label: search radius for the search of the maximum in the signal after a maximum in the cwt was found

param.name: spacing
param.label: Spacing of the CWT
param.help: Note that the accuracy of the picked peak's centroid position depends in the Raw data spacing, i.e., 50% of raw peak distance at most

param.name: deconvolution
param.label: If you want heavily overlapping peaks to be separated set this value to "true"

param.name: asym_threshold
param.label: If the symmetry of a peak is smaller than asym_thresholds it is assumed that it consists of more than one peak and the deconvolution procedure is started

param.name: left_width
param.label: 1/left_width is the initial value for the left width of the peaks found in the deconvolution step

param.name: right_width
param.label: 1/right_width is the initial value for the right width of the peaks found in the deconvolution step

param.name: scaling
param.label: Initial scaling of the cwt used in the separation of heavily overlapping peaks
param.help: The initial value is used for charge 1, for higher charges it is adapted to scaling/charge

param.name: fwhm_threshold
param.label: If the FWHM of a peak is higher than 'fwhm_thresholds' it is assumed that it consists of more than one peak and the deconvolution procedure is started

param.name: eps_abs
param.label: if the absolute error gets smaller than this value the fitting is stopped

param.name: eps_rel
param.label: if the relative error gets smaller than this value the fitting is stopped

param.name: max_iteration
param.label: maximal number of iterations for the fitting step

param.name: position
param.label: penalty term for the fitting of the peak position:If the position changes more than 0.5Da during the fitting it can be penalized as well as discrepancies of the peptide mass rule

param.name: height
param.label: penalty term for the fitting of the intensity:If it gets negative during the fitting it can be penalized

param.name: left_width
param.label: penalty term for the fitting of the left width:If the left width gets too broad or negative during the fitting it can be penalized

param.name: right_width
param.label: penalty term for the fitting of the right width:If the right width gets too broad or negative during the fitting it can be penalized

param.name: max_intensity
param.label: maximal intensity considered for histogram construction
param.help: By default, it will be calculated automatically (see auto_mode). Only provide this parameter if you know what you are doing (and change 'auto_mode' to '-1')! All intensities EQUAL/ABOVE 'max_intensity' will not be added to the histogram. If you choose 'max_intensity' too small, the noise estimate might be too small as well. If chosen too big, the bins become quite large (which you could counter by increasing 'bin_count', which increases runtime)

param.name: auto_max_stdev_factor
param.label: parameter for 'max_intensity' estimation (if 'auto_mode' == 0): mean + 'auto_max_stdev_factor' * stdev

param.name: auto_max_percentile
param.label: parameter for 'max_intensity' estimation (if 'auto_mode' == 1): auto_max_percentile th percentile

param.name: auto_mode
param.label: method to use to determine maximal intensity: -1 --> use 'max_intensity'; 0 --> 'auto_max_stdev_factor' method (default); 1 --> 'auto_max_percentile' method

param.name: win_len
param.label: window length in Thomson

param.name: bin_count
param.label: number of bins for intensity values

param.name: stdev_mp
param.label: multiplier for stdev

param.name: min_required_elements
param.label: minimum number of elements required in a window (otherwise it is considered sparse)

param.name: noise_for_empty_window
param.label: noise value used for sparse windows
Overrides tool-specific checks
Enables the test mode (needed for internal use only)

param.name: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS
param.label: Optional outputs

data.name: ctd_out
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: ctd
data.filter: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS is not None and "ctd_out_FLAG" in OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS

tool.help:
Applies time of flight calibration.
For more information, visit https://openms.de/doxygen/release/3.1.0/html/TOPP_TOFCalibration.html
